intro.title: HEIC JPG NOW - Free HEIC to JPG Converter
intro.content:
HEIC JPG NOW is a free online converter that turns HEIC photos from iPhone, iPad, Windows, Mac, or Android into universally compatible JPG files. Open the site in any browser, drag your photos, and start converting instantly—no downloads or plug-ins.

Batch mode handles entire trips or events at once, making it easy to resize photos for email, compress for social media, or open HEIC images on Windows 10/11, macOS, or older apps.

Every conversion runs locally inside your browser, so your files never leave your device. Use it as often as you like and start converting HEIC to JPG for free right now.

about.title: What is HEIC and why convert it to JPG?

heicFormat.title: Understanding the HEIC format
heicFormat.content: HEIC (High Efficiency Image Container) is Apple’s default photo format starting with iOS 11. It compresses images better than JPEG while preserving quality and metadata.

pros.title: Advantages
items: Smaller file sizes than JPEG with equivalent quality
Up to 16-bit color depth for richer gradients

cons.title: Drawbacks
items: Older Windows and Android devices can’t open HEIC by default
Many CMS tools and social platforms don’t accept .heic uploads
Needs conversion for printing, editing, or sharing in most workflows

jpgBenefits.title: Why export to JPG
items: Universal compatibility across devices, apps, and browsers
Ideal for emailing, social media, and online galleries
No plug-ins needed on older operating systems
Works with every major website builder and CMS
Smaller, optimized files improve upload speeds
Long-term archival is easier because JPG is an open standard

items.question: How do I do a HEIC to JPG conversion?
items.answer: Just drag files into the conversion area on the homepage and click Convert. It's a browser-based, no-install conversion. When it's done, you can download a ZIP in one click or save files one by one. Your photos are never sent to a server.

items.question: Can I batch convert HEIC files on iPhone?
items.answer: Yes. You can convert multiple files at once (batch). It works in browsers on iOS/Android phones and tablets, as well as Mac/Windows. For smoother performance, we recommend keeping each batch under 200 photos; if you have a lot of photos on iPhone, split them into smaller batches.

items.question: Do you support HEIF? What's the difference between JPG and JPEG?
items.answer: Yes, HEIF/HEIC are supported. JPG and JPEG are the same format: JPEG is the official name, while JPG is the common file extension. You can also use it for HEIC to JPEG conversions.

items.question: How do I convert HEIC to JPEG on iPhone?
items.answer: Open the tool in your iPhone browser, select your photos, and follow the steps. No app install and no sign-up required.

items.question: Is it safe to convert HEIC to JPG online?
items.answer: Yes. Conversion happens in your browser, and files are never sent to a server.

items.question: Are there limits on usage or number of files?
items.answer: It's completely free, with no strict limits on usage or file count. The practical limit depends on your device; we recommend up to 200 photos per batch, under 30MB per file, and under 1GB total to avoid memory slowdowns.

items.question: Will HEIC to JPG reduce image quality? Is EXIF preserved?
items.answer: Quality loss is usually minimal and hard to notice. We preserve EXIF when possible, but browser-based conversion can't guarantee 100% retention.

items.question: What's the easiest way to do a HEIC JPG conversion on Windows 10/11?
items.answer: Open HEIC JPG NOW (heicjpgnow.com), drag in your files, and click Convert. No installs, no sign-ups, no hidden fees, and you can download right away.
